00048 GenotypeExtendedReportEngine * GenotypeExtendedReportEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00049 {
00050         if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == GenotypeExtendedReportEngine::EngineName())
00051                 return (GenotypeExtendedReportEngine *)engine;
00052         return NULL;
00053 }

00055 GenotypeExtendedReportEngine::GenotypeExtendedReportEngine() : annotationFileHasOneCode(true) {
00056         defineOptions();
00057 }

00059 GenotypeExtendedReportEngine::~GenotypeExtendedReportEngine() {
00060 }

00062 void GenotypeExtendedReportEngine::defineOptions() {
00063         defineOption("", "calls-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00064                 "Text file specifying genotype calls.",
00065                 "");
00066         defineOption("", "forced-calls-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00067                 "Text file specifying forced genotype calls.",
00068                 "");
00069         defineOption("", "count-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00070                 "Text file specifying counts.",
00071                 "");
00072         defineOption("", "cv-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00073                 "Text file specifying cvs.",
00074                 "");
00075         defineOption("", "confidence-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00076                 "Text file specifying the genotype confidence values.",
00077                 "");
00078         defineOption("m", "summaries", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00079                 "Text file specifying the signal summaries.",
00080                 "");
00081         defineOption("", "out-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00082                 "The output file.",
00083                 "");
00084         defineOption("", "output-sample-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00085                 "The column name to use for the sample column.",
00086                 "Sample");
00087         defineOption("", "output-marker-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00088                 "The column name to use for the marker column.",
00089                 "Marker");
00090         defineOption("", "marker-content-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00091                 "Text file specifying the mix file.",
00092                 "");
00093         defineOption("", "annotation-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00094                 "The annotation file.",
00095                 "");
00096         defineOption("", "note-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00097                 "The column name for the note.",
00098                 "Note");
00099         defineOption("", "probe-id-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00100                 "The column name for the probe id.",
00101                 "Probe Id");
00102         defineOption("", "type-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00103                 "The column name for the type.",
00104                 "Type");
00105         defineOption("", "summaries-norm", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00106                 "The normalized signal summary file.",
00107                 "");
00108         defineOption("", "stretch-constant", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00109                 "The stretch constant for the cluster transformation.",
00110                 "1.5");
00111         defineOption("", "cluster-transformation", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00112                 "The type of cluster transformation. Can be one of CES, CCS, MvA, RvT.",
00113                 "CES");
00114 }

00118 /**
00119  * Make sure that our options are sane. Call Err::errAbort if not.
00120  */
00121 void GenotypeExtendedReportEngine::checkOptionsImp()
00122 {
00123     defineStates();
00124 
00125         string str = getOpt("out-file");
00126         if (str.empty() == true)
00127                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an output file name.");
00128 
00129         str = getOpt("confidence-file");
00130         if (str.empty() == true)
00131                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input confidence file.");
00132 
00133         str = getOpt("cv-file");
00134         if (str.empty() == true)
00135                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input cv file.");
00136 
00137         str = getOpt("count-file");
00138         if (str.empty() == true)
00139                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input count file.");
00140 
00141         str = getOpt("summaries");
00142         if (str.empty() == true)
00143                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input summaries file.");
00144 
00145         str = getOpt("calls-file");
00146         if (str.empty() == true)
00147                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input call file.");
00148 
00149         str = getOpt("marker-content-file");
00150         if (str.empty() == true)
00151                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input marker file.");
00152 
00153         str = getOpt("annotation-file");
00154         if (str.empty() == true)
00155                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an annotation file.");
00156 
00157         str = getOpt("summaries-norm");
00158         if (str.empty() == true)
00159                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an input normalized signal summary file.");
00160 }
00161 
00162 void GenotypeExtendedReportEngine::writeHeader(std::ofstream &out)
00163 {
00164         std::vector<std::string> option_names;
00165         getOptionNames(option_names);
00166         std::vector<PgOpt::PgOptType> option_types;
00167         getOptionTypes(option_types);
00168         for (int i = 0; i < option_names.size(); i++) 
00169         {
00170                 switch (option_types[i]) 
00171                 {
00172                 case PgOpt::BOOL_OPT:
00173                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptBool(option_names[i]) << endl;
00174                         break;
00175                 case PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT:
00176                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptDouble(option_names[i]) << endl;
00177                         break;
00178                 case PgOpt::INT_OPT:
00179                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptInt(option_names[i]) << endl;
00180                         break;
00181                 case PgOpt::STRING_OPT:
00182                         if (getOpt(option_names[i]).empty() == false)
00183                                 out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOpt(option_names[i]) << endl;
00184                 }
00185         }
00186 }
00187 
00188 void GenotypeExtendedReportEngine::processSingleChannelFiles()
00189 {
00190         string callFile = getOpt("calls-file");
00191         string countFile = getOpt("count-file");
00192         string cvFile = getOpt("cv-file");
00193         string forcedFile = getOpt("forced-calls-file");
00194         string confFile = getOpt("confidence-file");
00195         string sumFile = getOpt("summaries");
00196         string outFile = getOpt("out-file");
00197         string sampleCol = getOpt("output-sample-col");
00198         string markerCol = getOpt("output-marker-col");
00199         string normFile = getOpt("summaries-norm");
00200         double k = getOptDouble("stretch-constant");
00201         enum Transformation transformation = transformationForString(getOpt("cluster-transformation"));
00202 
00203         // Open the input files.
00204         affx::TsvFile callTsv;
00205         if(callTsv.open(callFile) != TSV_OK)
00206                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + callFile);
00207         callTsv.rewind();
00208         affx::TsvFile forcedTsv;
00209         if (forcedFile.empty() == false)
00210         {
00211                 if(forcedTsv.open(forcedFile) != TSV_OK)
00212                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + forcedFile);
00213                 forcedTsv.rewind();
00214         }
00215         affx::TsvFile confTsv;
00216         if(confTsv.open(confFile) != TSV_OK)
00217                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + confFile);
00218         confTsv.rewind();
00219         affx::TsvFile countTsv;
00220         if(countTsv.open(countFile) != TSV_OK)
00221                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + countFile);
00222         countTsv.rewind();
00223         affx::TsvFile cvTsv;
00224         if(cvTsv.open(cvFile) != TSV_OK)
00225                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + cvFile);
00226         cvTsv.rewind();
00227         affx::TsvFile sumTsv;
00228         if(sumTsv.open(sumFile) != TSV_OK)
00229                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + sumFile);
00230         sumTsv.rewind();
00231         affx::TsvFile normTsv;
00232         if(normTsv.open(normFile) != TSV_OK)
00233                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + normFile);
00234         normTsv.rewind();
00235 
00236         // Check the number of columns.
00237         if ((callTsv.getColumnCount(0) == confTsv.getColumnCount(0) &&
00238                  confTsv.getColumnCount(0) == sumTsv.getColumnCount(0) &&
00239                  sumTsv.getColumnCount(0) == countTsv.getColumnCount(0) &&
00240                  countTsv.getColumnCount(0) == cvTsv.getColumnCount(0) &&
00241                  cvTsv.getColumnCount(0) == normTsv.getColumnCount(0)) == false)
00242                  Err::errAbort("The column counts in the input files do not match");
00243 
00244         // Create an output file
00245         ofstream out(outFile.c_str(), ios::out);
00246         writeHeader(out);
00247         out << getOpt("output-sample-col") << "\t" << getOpt("output-marker-col") << "\t" << "Call\t";
00248         if (forcedFile.empty() == false)
00249                 out << "Forced Call\t";
00250         out << "Confidence\tRaw_Signal_A\tRaw_Signal_B\tCount_A\tCount_B\tCV_A\tCV_B\tContrast\tStrength" << endl;
00251 
00252         // The first column are the marker names. The remaining columns are the data.
00253         // The call codes are: -1=NN, 0=AA, 1=AB, 2=BB
00254         // Output the data by sample then by marker. One row per marker per sample.
00255         int ncols = callTsv.getColumnCount(0);
00256         string sample;
00257         string marker;
00258         int callData;
00259         int forcedData;
00260         string name;
00261         string confData;
00262         string signalData;
00263         string aSignal;
00264         string bSignal;
00265         int countData;
00266         int aCount;
00267         int bCount;
00268         string cvData;
00269         string aCV;
00270         string bCV;
00271         double aNormSignal;
00272         double bNormSignal;
00273         double normData;
00274         double strength;
00275         double contrast;
00276         bool dataAvailable;
00277         string callCodes[] = {"NoCall", "AA", "AB", "BB"};
00278 
00279         // Work on one sample at a time.
00280         for (int i=1; i<ncols; i++)
00281         {
00282                 sample = callTsv.getColumnName(0, i);
00283 
00284                 callTsv.unbindAll();
00285                 callTsv.rewind();
00286                 callTsv.bind(0, 0, &marker, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00287                 callTsv.bind(0, i, &callData, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00288 
00289                 if (forcedFile.empty() == false)
00290                 {
00291                         forcedTsv.unbindAll();
00292                         forcedTsv.rewind();
00293                         forcedTsv.bind(0, i, &forcedData, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00294                 }
00295 
00296                 confTsv.unbindAll();
00297                 confTsv.rewind();
00298                 confTsv.bind(0, i, &confData, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00299 
00300                 countTsv.unbindAll();
00301                 countTsv.rewind();
00302                 countTsv.bind(0, i, &countData, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00303 
00304                 cvTsv.unbindAll();
00305                 cvTsv.rewind();
00306                 cvTsv.bind(0, i, &cvData, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00307 
00308                 sumTsv.unbindAll();
00309                 sumTsv.rewind();
00310                 sumTsv.bind(0, 0, &name, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00311                 sumTsv.bind(0, i, &signalData, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00312 
00313                 normTsv.unbindAll();
00314                 normTsv.rewind();
00315                 normTsv.bind(0, i, &normData, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00316 
00317                 // Read all of the output files for just the one sample's data.
00318                 while (true)
00319                 {
00320                         // If we are at the end of the file then break out of the while loop.
00321                         if (sumTsv.nextLevel(0) != TSV_OK)
00322                                 break;
00323 
00324                         // Check if the probe set is a control and skip it if its a control.
00325                         if (controlMap.find(name) != controlMap.end())
00326                         {
00327                                 countTsv.nextLevel(0);
00328                                 cvTsv.nextLevel(0);
00329                                 continue;
00330                         }
00331 
00332                         countTsv.nextLevel(0);
00333                         aCount = countData;
00334                         countTsv.nextLevel(0);
00335                         bCount = countData;
00336                         dataAvailable = (aCount > 0 && bCount > 0);
00337 
00338                         normTsv.nextLevel(0);
00339                         aNormSignal = normData;
00340                         normTsv.nextLevel(0);
00341                         bNormSignal = normData;
00342                         if (dataAvailable == true)
00343                                 valueForTransformation(aNormSignal, bNormSignal, transformation, k, contrast, strength);
00344 
00345                         aSignal = signalData;
00346                         sumTsv.nextLevel(0);
00347                         bSignal = signalData;
00348 
00349                         cvTsv.nextLevel(0);
00350                         aCV = cvData;
00351                         cvTsv.nextLevel(0);
00352                         bCV = cvData;
00353 
00354                         callTsv.nextLevel(0);
00355                         confTsv.nextLevel(0);
00356 
00357                         out << sample << "\t" << marker << "\t" << callCodes[callData+1] << "\t";
00358                         if (forcedFile.empty() == false)
00359                         {
00360                                 forcedTsv.nextLevel(0);
00361                                 out << callCodes[forcedData+1] << "\t";
00362                         }
00363 
00364                         out << (dataAvailable == true ? confData : "NaN") << "\t";
00365                         out << (aCount > 0 ? aSignal : "NaN") << "\t";
00366                         out << (bCount > 0 ? bSignal : "NaN") << "\t";
00367                         out << aCount << "\t";
00368                         out << bCount << "\t";
00369                         out << (aCount > 0 ? aCV : "NaN") << "\t";
00370                         out << (bCount > 0 ? bCV : "NaN") << "\t";
00371                         if (dataAvailable == true)
00372                                 out << contrast << "\t" << strength << endl;
00373                         else
00374                                 out << "NaN\tNaN" << endl;
00375                 }
00376         }
00377 
00378         // Close the files.
00379         out.close();
00380         callTsv.close();
00381         confTsv.close();
00382         sumTsv.close();
00383         if (forcedFile.empty() == false)
00384                 forcedTsv.close();
00385 }
00386 
00387 static vector<string> foo(string data[2], string names[2], bool oneFile)
00388 {
00389         vector<string> result(2);
00390 
00391         result[0] = "NaN";
00392         result[1] = "NaN";
00393 
00394         int count = oneFile == true ? 1 : 2;
00395         for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
00396         {
00397                 string::size_type n = names[i].find_last_of("-");
00398                 if (n != string::npos)
00399                 {
00400                         string x = names[i].substr(n + 1, 1);
00401 
00402                         if (x == "A")
00403                                 result[0] = data[i];
00404                         else
00405                                 result[1] = data[i];
00406                 }
00407         }
00408 
00409         return result;
00410 }
00411 
00412 void GenotypeExtendedReportEngine::processMultiChannelFiles()
00413 {
00414         string callFile = getOpt("calls-file");
00415         string countFile = getOpt("count-file");
00416         string cvFile = getOpt("cv-file");
00417         string forcedFile = getOpt("forced-calls-file");
00418         string confFile = getOpt("confidence-file");
00419         string sumFile = getOpt("summaries");
00420         string outFile = getOpt("out-file");
00421         string sampleCol = getOpt("output-sample-col");
00422         string markerCol = getOpt("output-marker-col");
00423         string normFile = getOpt("summaries-norm");
00424         double k = getOptDouble("stretch-constant");
00425         enum Transformation transformation = transformationForString(getOpt("cluster-transformation"));
00426 
00427         // Check that there is two summary and cv files.
00428         vector<string> sumFiles = StringUtils::Split(sumFile, "?");
00429         bool oneSumFile = sumFiles.size() == 1;
00430         if (sumFiles.size() > 2 )
00431         {
00432                 Err::errAbort("Too many input summaries files.");
00433         }
00434 
00435         vector<string> cvFiles = StringUtils::Split(cvFile, "?");
00436         bool oneCVFile = cvFiles.size() == 1;
00437         if (cvFiles.size() > 2)
00438         {
00439                 Err::errAbort("Two many input cv files.");
00440         }
00441 
00442         // Open the input files.
00443         affx::TsvFile callTsv;
00444         if(callTsv.open(callFile) != TSV_OK)
00445                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + callFile);
00446         callTsv.rewind();
00447         affx::TsvFile forcedTsv;
00448         if (forcedFile.empty() == false)
00449         {
00450                 if(forcedTsv.open(forcedFile) != TSV_OK)
00451                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + forcedFile);
00452                 forcedTsv.rewind();
00453         }
00454         affx::TsvFile confTsv;
00455         if(confTsv.open(confFile) != TSV_OK)
00456                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + confFile);
00457         confTsv.rewind();
00458         affx::TsvFile countTsv;
00459         if(countTsv.open(countFile) != TSV_OK)
00460                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + countFile);
00461         countTsv.rewind();
00462         affx::TsvFile cvTsv[2];
00463         if(cvTsv[0].open(cvFiles[0]) != TSV_OK)
00464                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + cvFiles[0]);
00465         cvTsv[0].rewind();
00466         if(oneCVFile == false)
00467         {
00468                 if (cvTsv[1].open(cvFiles[1]) != TSV_OK)
00469                 {
00470                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + cvFiles[1]);
00471                 }
00472                 cvTsv[1].rewind();
00473         }
00474         affx::TsvFile sumTsv[2];
00475         if(sumTsv[0].open(sumFiles[0]) != TSV_OK)
00476                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + sumFiles[0]);
00477         sumTsv[0].rewind();
00478         if (oneSumFile == false)
00479         {
00480                 if (sumTsv[1].open(sumFiles[1]) != TSV_OK)
00481                 {
00482                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + sumFiles[1]);
00483                 }
00484                 sumTsv[1].rewind();
00485         }
00486         affx::TsvFile normTsv;
00487         if(normTsv.open(normFile) != TSV_OK)
00488                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + normFile);
00489         normTsv.rewind();
00490 
00491         // Check the number of columns.
00492         if ((callTsv.getColumnCount(0) == confTsv.getColumnCount(0) &&
00493                  confTsv.getColumnCount(0) == sumTsv[0].getColumnCount(0) &&
00494                  sumTsv[0].getColumnCount(0) == countTsv.getColumnCount(0) &&
00495                  countTsv.getColumnCount(0) == cvTsv[0].getColumnCount(0) &&
00496                  cvTsv[0].getColumnCount(0) == normTsv.getColumnCount(0)) == false &&
00497                  (oneCVFile == true ||  cvTsv[1].getColumnCount(0) == countTsv.getColumnCount(0)) &&
00498                  (oneSumFile == true ||  sumTsv[1].getColumnCount(0) == countTsv.getColumnCount(0)))
00499                  Err::errAbort("The column counts in the input files do not match");
00500 
00501         // Create an output file
00502         ofstream out(outFile.c_str(), ios::out);
00503         writeHeader(out);
00504         out << getOpt("output-sample-col") << "\t" << getOpt("output-marker-col") << "\t" << "Call\t";
00505         if (forcedFile.empty() == false)
00506                 out << "Forced Call\t";
00507         out << "Confidence\tRaw_Signal_A\tRaw_Signal_B\tCount\tCV_A\tCV_B\tContrast\tStrength" << endl;
00508 
00509         // The first column are the marker names. The remaining columns are the data.
00510         // The call codes are: -1=NN, 0=AA, 1=AB, 2=BB
00511         // Output the data by sample then by marker. One row per marker per sample.
00512         int ncols = callTsv.getColumnCount(0);
00513         string sample;
00514         string marker;
00515         int callData;
00516         int forcedData;
00517         string sumNames[2];
00518         string cvNames[2];
00519         string confData;
00520         string signalData[2];
00521         vector<string> signalInAlleleOrder;
00522         //string aSignal;
00523         //string bSignal;
00524         //int countData;
00525         int count;
00526         string cvData[2];
00527         vector<string> cvInAlleleOrder;
00528         //string aCV;
00529         //string bCV;
00530         double aNormSignal;
00531         double bNormSignal;
00532         double normData;
00533         double strength;
00534         double contrast;
00535         bool dataAvailable;
00536         string callCodes[] = {"NoCall", "AA", "AB", "BB"};
00537 
00538         // Work on one sample at a time.
00539         for (int i=1; i<ncols; i++)
00540         {
00541                 sample = callTsv.getColumnName(0, i);
00542 
00543                 callTsv.unbindAll();
00544                 callTsv.rewind();
00545                 callTsv.bind(0, 0, &marker, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00546                 callTsv.bind(0, i, &callData, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00547 
00548                 if (forcedFile.empty() == false)
00549                 {
00550                         forcedTsv.unbindAll();
00551                         forcedTsv.rewind();
00552                         forcedTsv.bind(0, i, &forcedData, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00553                 }
00554 
00555                 confTsv.unbindAll();
00556                 confTsv.rewind();
00557                 confTsv.bind(0, i, &confData, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00558 
00559                 countTsv.unbindAll();
00560                 countTsv.rewind();
00561                 countTsv.bind(0, i, &count, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00562 
00563                 cvTsv[0].unbindAll();
00564                 cvTsv[0].rewind();
00565                 cvTsv[0].bind(0, 0, &cvNames[0], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00566                 cvTsv[0].bind(0, i, &cvData[0], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00567 
00568                 if (oneCVFile == false)
00569                 {
00570                         cvTsv[1].unbindAll();
00571                         cvTsv[1].rewind();
00572                         cvTsv[1].bind(0, 0, &cvNames[1], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00573                         cvTsv[1].bind(0, i, &cvData[1], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00574                 }
00575 
00576                 sumTsv[0].unbindAll();
00577                 sumTsv[0].rewind();
00578                 sumTsv[0].bind(0, 0, &sumNames[0], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00579                 sumTsv[0].bind(0, i, &signalData[0], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00580 
00581                 if (oneSumFile == false)
00582                 {
00583                         sumTsv[1].unbindAll();
00584                         sumTsv[1].rewind();
00585                         sumTsv[1].bind(0, 0, &sumNames[1], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00586                         sumTsv[1].bind(0, i, &signalData[1], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00587                 }
00588 
00589                 normTsv.unbindAll();
00590                 normTsv.rewind();
00591                 normTsv.bind(0, i, &normData, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00592 
00593                 // Read all of the output files for just the one sample's data.
00594                 while (true)
00595                 {
00596                         // If we are at the end of the file then break out of the while loop.
00597                         if (sumTsv[0].nextLevel(0) != TSV_OK)
00598                                 break;
00599 
00600                         if (oneSumFile == false && sumTsv[1].nextLevel(0) != TSV_OK)
00601                                 break;
00602 
00603                         // Check if the probe set is a control and skip it if its a control.
00604                         if (controlMap.find(sumNames[0]) != controlMap.end())
00605                         {
00606                                 countTsv.nextLevel(0);
00607                                 cvTsv[0].nextLevel(0);
00608                                 if (oneCVFile == false)
00609                                         cvTsv[1].nextLevel(0);
00610                                 continue;
00611                         }
00612 
00613                         countTsv.nextLevel(0);
00614                         dataAvailable = (count > 0);
00615 
00616                         normTsv.nextLevel(0);
00617                         aNormSignal = normData;
00618                         normTsv.nextLevel(0);
00619                         bNormSignal = normData;
00620                         if (dataAvailable == true)
00621                                 valueForTransformation(aNormSignal, bNormSignal, transformation, k, contrast, strength);
00622 
00623                         signalInAlleleOrder = foo(signalData, sumNames, oneSumFile);
00624 
00625                         cvTsv[0].nextLevel(0);
00626                         if (oneCVFile == false)
00627                                 cvTsv[1].nextLevel(0);
00628 
00629                         cvInAlleleOrder = foo(cvData, cvNames, oneCVFile);
00630 
00631                         callTsv.nextLevel(0);
00632                         confTsv.nextLevel(0);
00633 
00634                         out << sample << "\t" << marker << "\t" << callCodes[callData+1] << "\t";
00635                         if (forcedFile.empty() == false)
00636                         {
00637                                 forcedTsv.nextLevel(0);
00638                                 out << callCodes[forcedData+1] << "\t";
00639                         }
00640 
00641                         out << (dataAvailable == true ? confData : "NaN") << "\t";
00642                         out << (count > 0 ? signalInAlleleOrder[0] : "NaN") << "\t";
00643                         out << (count > 0 ? signalInAlleleOrder[1] : "NaN") << "\t";
00644                         out << count << "\t";
00645                         out << (count > 0 ? cvInAlleleOrder[0] : "NaN") << "\t";
00646                         out << (count > 0 ? cvInAlleleOrder[1] : "NaN") << "\t";
00647                         if (dataAvailable == true)
00648                                 out << contrast << "\t" << strength << endl;
00649                         else
00650                                 out << "NaN\tNaN" << endl;
00651                 }
00652         }
00653 
00654         // Close the files.
00655         out.close();
00656         callTsv.close();
00657         confTsv.close();
00658         sumTsv[0].close();
00659         if (oneSumFile == false)
00660                 sumTsv[1].close();
00661         cvTsv[0].close();
00662         if (oneCVFile == false)
00663                 cvTsv[1].close();
00664         if (forcedFile.empty() == false)
00665                 forcedTsv.close();
00666 }
00667 
00668 void GenotypeExtendedReportEngine::readMixFile()
00669 {
00670         string mixFile = getOpt("marker-content-file");
00671 
00672         // Open the mix file and store those negative type entries.
00673         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00674         if(tsv.open(mixFile) != TSV_OK)
00675                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + mixFile);
00676         tsv.rewind();
00677         int typeValue;
00678         string note;
00679         string id;
00680         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("type-col"), &typeValue, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00681         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("note-col"), &note, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00682         tsv.bind(0, getOpt("probe-id-col"), &id, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00683         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00684         {
00685                 if (typeValue < 0)
00686                 {
00687                         if (id.empty() == true)
00688                                 id = note;
00689                         controlMap[id] = true;
00690                 }
00691         }
00692         tsv.clear();
00693 }
00694 
00695 void GenotypeExtendedReportEngine::readAnnotationFile()
00696 {
00697         string annotFile = getOpt("annotation-file");
00698 
00699         // Open the annotation file to determine how to read the count file.
00700         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00701         if(tsv.open(annotFile) != TSV_OK)
00702                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + annotFile);
00703         int numChannels = 1;
00704         if (tsv.getHeader("num-channels", numChannels) == TSV_OK)
00705         {
00706                 annotationFileHasOneCode = (numChannels == 1);
00707         }
00708         tsv.clear();
00709 }
00710 
00711 /**
00712    This is the "main()" equivalent of the engine.
00713 */
00714 void GenotypeExtendedReportEngine::runImp()
00715 {
00716         readMixFile();
00717         readAnnotationFile();
00718 
00719         if (annotationFileHasOneCode == true)
00720         {
00721                 processSingleChannelFiles();
00722         }
00723         else
00724         {
00725                 processMultiChannelFiles();
00726         }
00727 }
